title: Phrasal Verbs With Drop And Draw

questions.question: I dropped ............................. my aunt's house yesterday.
questions.description: To drop round is to visit without making an arrangement.

questions.question: The demand for digital cameras has dropped ............................
questions.description: It demand drops off, it becomes less.

questions.question: I dropped ..................................... in the middle of the show.
questions.description: To drop off is to begin to sleep.

questions.question: Profits dropped ................................. during the last quarter.
questions.description: Drop off can mean become less.

questions.question: Get in. I will drop you ............................... at college.
questions.description: To drop somebody off is to take them to a place.

questions.question: Aunt Martha would often drop .......................................... on us.
questions.description: To drop in on somebody is to visit them informally.

questions.question: You can drop .................................... whenever you want.
questions.description: To drop over is to visit casually.

questions.question: Nights draw ...................................... fast in winter.
questions.description: When nights draw in they start earlier.

questions.question: He drew ................................. the lecture unnecessarily.
questions.description: To draw out a lecture is to make it longer.

questions.question: Drivers are required to draw .................................. at the lights.
questions.description: To draw up is to halt.

questions.question: I don't want to get drawn ......................................... this scandal.
The protestors drew .................................. when the police approached them.
questions.description: To draw back is to move away.
